container.paragraph: Set automatic ids throughout the model

For times when you don’t want to manually set id attributes through the model, you can use the Printer to do it for you. When serialising a model using the printModel function, the optional second argument is a boolean switch indicating whether or not to assign automatic id attributes to any items which don’t already have one. Existing id attributes are unchanged by this process, and by default it is turned off.
The automatic ids adhere to the XML standard for id attributes, and take the form of a 6-digit hexadecimal number, beginning with a letter.

# Create a Parser to deserialise a CellML (in_string) string into a model. parser = libcellml.Parser() model = parser.parseModel(in_string)
# Create a Printer to serialise the model back to a string, but # use the option to create automatic ids. printer = libcellml.Printer() out_string = printer.printModel(model, true)
# The out_string will have the same model contents, but with id attributes set throughout.
